name: getenforce
desc: `getenforce` command line is used to display the execution mode of SELinux.

-L.name: List current supported context types defined in the SELinux policy

-l.name: Display all context types defined in the SELinux policy

-m.name: Display all modules defined in the SELinux policy

-M.name: Display a module defined in the SELinux policy

content:
Example

  • Check the execution mode of SELinux:

    getenforce

  • List current supported context types defined in the SELinux policy:

    getenforce -L

  • Display all context types defined in the SELinux policy:

    getenforce -l

  • Display all modules defined in the SELinux policy:

    getenforce -m

  • Display a module defined in the SELinux policy:

    getenforce -M

  • Display SELinux status information:

    getenforce -S
